messageBody:
Louise,

The unstated assumption in the article is that along with the abstract
class Source there is a concrete class InstanceMessageSource, whose
test could look simply like this:

InstantMessageSourceTest extends AbstractSourceTestCase {
private Source source;

@Override public void setUp() {
source = new InstanceMessageSource();
}


@Override public Source getSource() {
return source;
}

@Override public Serializable prepareAndGetExpectedMessage() {
source.receiveMessage("O RLY?");
}
}

Share and Enjoy,

David Saff

> I read in the FAQ about testing abstract classes, but I do not

> Liskov Substitution Principle mentioned in the article.
>
> If someone has a simple example of testing abstract classes with
> JUnit, or could explain it, I would really appreciate it.
> Or should an abstract class simply be tested through the classes that
> extends the abstract class?
